title: Authors and Citation
text: Larry Dong. Author, maintainer. Kuan Liu. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Dong L, Liu K (2023). causens: Perform causal sensitivity analyses using various statistical methods. R package version 0.0.1, https://github.com/Kuan-Liu-Lab/causens, https://kuan-liu-lab.github.io/causens/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {causens: Perform causal sensitivity analyses using various statistical methods},   author = {Larry Dong and Kuan Liu},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.1, https://github.com/Kuan-Liu-Lab/causens},   url = {https://kuan-liu-lab.github.io/causens/}, }

title: Perform causal sensitivity analyses using various statistical methods
text: causens R package allow perform various sensitivity analysis methods within context causal inference.

title: Perform causal sensitivity analyses using various statistical methods
code: # The easiest way is to install from CRAN via: install.packages("causens")  # Alternatively, you can install the latest version directly from GitHub install.packages("devtools") library(devtools) devtools::install_github("Kuan-Liu-Lab/causens") library(causens)

title: Perform causal sensitivity analyses using various statistical methods
Perform causal sensitivity analyses using various statistical methods
text: Please cite software using:
code: @Manual{,   title = {causens: Perform causal sensitivity analyses using various statistical methods},   author = {Larry Dong, Kuan Liu},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.1,  https://kuan-liu-lab.github.io/causens/},   url = {https://github.com/Kuan-Liu-Lab/causens/}, }

title: Perform causal sensitivity analyses using various statistical methods
text: Please report bugs opening issue. question regarding usage causens, start discussion.

what: Estimate Corrected Average Treatment Effect — causens
title: Estimate Corrected Average Treatment Effect — causens
text: function provides estimate Average Treatment Effect (ATE) using outcomes corrected unmeasured confounding via sensitivity function.

title: Estimate Corrected Average Treatment Effect — causens
code: causens(   trt_model,   data,   exposure,   outcome,   sf = "constant",   c1 = 0.5,   c0 = 0.3 )

title: Estimate Corrected Average Treatment Effect — causens
text: trt_model treatment model object. data data frame containing variables interest. exposure name exposure variable. outcome name outcome variable. sf R sensitivity function c(z, e). confounders vector names confounding variables.

title: Estimate Corrected Average Treatment Effect — causens
text: point estimate corrected ATE.

what: Outcomes Corrected via Sensitivity Function — corrected_outcomes
title: Outcomes Corrected via Sensitivity Function — corrected_outcomes
text: function provides corrected outcomes corrected using sensitivity function c(z, e).

title: Outcomes Corrected via Sensitivity Function — corrected_outcomes
code: corrected_outcomes(   trt_model,   data,   exposure,   outcome,   sf = "constant",   c1 = 0.5,   c0 = 0.3 )

title: Outcomes Corrected via Sensitivity Function — corrected_outcomes
text: trt_model treatment model object. data data frame containing variables interest. exposure name exposure variable. outcome name outcome variable. sf R sensitivity function c(z, e). confounders vector names confounding variables.

title: Outcomes Corrected via Sensitivity Function — corrected_outcomes
text: vector corresponding corrected outcomes.

title: Outcomes Corrected via Sensitivity Function — corrected_outcomes
code: data <- data.frame(   exposure = c(0, 1, 0, 1),   outcome = c(0, 1, 0, 1),   confounder1 = c(1, 0, 1, 0),   confounder2 = c(0, 1, 0, 1) ) corrected_outcomes(data, "exposure", "outcome", c(   "confounder1",   "confounder2" ), 0.5) #> Warning: coercing argument of type 'character' to logical #> Error in corrected_outcomes(data, "exposure", "outcome", c("confounder1",     "confounder2"), 0.5): Non-binary exposures are not yet supported in causens.

what: Generate data with a binary unmeasured confounder and binary outcome — gData_U_binary_Y_binary
title: Generate data with a binary unmeasured confounder and binary outcome — gData_U_binary_Y_binary
text: Generate data binary unmeasured confounder binary outcome

title: Generate data with a binary unmeasured confounder and binary outcome — gData_U_binary_Y_binary
code: gData_U_binary_Y_binary(   ymodel = "linear",   N = 500,   alpha_uz = 0.2,   beta_uy = 0.5,   treatment_effects = 1,   seed = 123 )

title: Generate data with a binary unmeasured confounder and binary outcome — gData_U_binary_Y_binary
text: ymodel string indicating functional form outcome model. N number observations generated. alpha_uz coefficient unmeasured confounder propensity score model. beta_uy coefficient unmeasured confounder outcome model. treatment_effects treatment effect. seed seed random number generator.

title: Generate data with a binary unmeasured confounder and continuous outcome — gData_U_binary_Y_cont

title: Generate data with a binary unmeasured confounder and continuous outcome — gData_U_binary_Y_cont
code: fulldata <- gData_U_binary_Y_cont(   ymodel = "linear",   N = 500,   alpha_uz = 0.2,   beta_uy = 0.5,   treatment_effects = 1,   seed = 123 ) table(fulldata$Z) #>  #>   0   1  #> 238 262

what: Calculate sensitivity of treatment effect estimate to unmeasured confounding — sensitivity_function
title: Calculate sensitivity of treatment effect estimate to unmeasured confounding — sensitivity_function
text: function calculates sensitivity treatment effect estimate unmeasured confounding, described Rosenbaum (2002). sensitivity defined maximum strength association unmeasured confounder treatment assignment needed explain away observed treatment effect estimate. function assumes treatment assignment binary outcome continuous.

title: Calculate sensitivity of treatment effect estimate to unmeasured confounding — sensitivity_function
Calculate sensitivity of treatment effect estimate to unmeasured confounding — sensitivity_function
text: z Treatment assignment (binary: 0 1) e Propensity score value (numeric) form Form sensitivity function (character: "increasing" "decreasing")

title: Calculate sensitivity of treatment effect estimate to unmeasured confounding — sensitivity_function
text: Sensitivity treatment effect estimate unmeasured confounding (numeric) sf(z, e, form)

what: Generate data with unmeasured confounder — simulate_data
title: Generate data with unmeasured confounder — simulate_data
text: Generate data unmeasured confounder

title: Generate data with unmeasured confounder — simulate_data
code: simulate_data(   ymodel = "linear",   N = 500,   u_type = "binary",   y_type = "continuous",   seed = 123,   alpha_uz = 0.2,   beta_uy = 0.5,   treatment_effects = 1 )

title: Generate data with unmeasured confounder — simulate_data
text: ymodel string indicating functional form outcome model. N number observations generated. u_type string indicating type unmeasured confounder: "binary" "continuous". y_type string indicating type outcome: "binary" "continuous". seed seed random number generator. alpha_uz coefficient unmeasured confounder propensity score model. beta_uy coefficient unmeasured confounder outcome model. treatment_effects treatment effect.

title: Generate data with unmeasured confounder — simulate_data
text: data frame simulated dataset.
